intro: Gymnocalycium riojense var. guasayanense, commonly known as the Guasayán prickly pear, is a cactus species native to northern Argentina. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its globose, spiny stems that are often covered in white, powdery bloom. The plant produces yellow flowers during the summer months, which are followed by edible, red fruits. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting well to poor soil conditions. This variety is valued for both its ornamental appeal and its role in local ecosystems.
